knowledge.question: Why is a cast necessary in the above code snippet?
choices: because int cannot be assigned to float variables
otherwise floating point precision would be lost in the division
float casting is required for int division
to reduce the length of the division result
explanation: Incorrect: int can be assigned to floating point variables

Correct: if x is not cast to a float, x/y would result in int division providing an int result and losing any floating point results. Casting one of the vaiables to a float will result in the equation evaluating to a floating point number
Incorrect: float casting is not required but precision will be lost without it
Incorrect: casting to a float will not reduce the size of the result
